analysis: The documents primarily concern the implementation and modification of the National Industrial Recovery Act (NIRA) and related labor and industrial regulations during the Roosevelt and subsequent presidencies. They cover a range of industries and address issues such as fair competition, labor standards, wage adjustments, and the establishment of various boards and committees to oversee these regulations. Some documents also deal with national defense and export regulations. The sentiment is generally positive, reflecting the government's efforts to stabilize the economy and promote fair labor practices, though some documents also acknowledge disagreements and the need for further investigation and adjustments.
title: NIRA Implementation and Labor Standards
